intro: Taeniophyllum glandulosum, commonly known as the hairy taeniophyllum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, glandular leaves and clusters of delicate, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
